Nalley, Louisa (nee FArnsworth)
               Louisa FArnSWORTH Nalley, wife of ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Louisa FArnSWORTH Nalley, wife of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 George W. Nalley, died September 25, 1912, the daughter of John FArnSWORTH. She was born February 22, 1841, and married George Nalley on November 11, 1860. Mrs. Nalley died in her home on Walnut Hill in Wayne township, Monroe County, Ohio. She was the parent of Clement L. ELLSWORTH and Mrs. Emma J. EARLY. She was buried at the Barber Ridge cemetery.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, October 3, 1912

Nalley, Robby Dale
Source--Daily Jeffersonian      Cambridge, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cambridge, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio
Published--December 30,1985
            WOODSFIELD--Robby Dale Nalley , 24, of  Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3, died ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> WOODSFIELD--Robby Dale Nalley , 24, of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3, died >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Sunday, December 29, 1985 at his residence.
He was born August 13,1961, in Barnesville, the son of Herbert and Bonnie Lucas Nalley of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3.
In addition to his parents, he leaves his wife, Cheryl Dalrymple Nalley of the home; two daughters Heather and Christa, both of the home, a son ,Jason, also of the home; two brothers, Gene Nalley and Kerry Nalley, both of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3; four sisters, Bonnie Dalrymple, Lisa Nalley and Valerie Nalley, all of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 3 and a paternal grandmother, Emma Nalley of Woodsfield, Rural Delivery 1.
Friends may call from 2 to 9 p.m. today at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where services will be at 1 p.m. Tuesday with the Reverend Joe Moore officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.
Nalley, Rose Ann( Nalley) Okey
November 12,1947  
     Rose Ann ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>November 12,1947

Nalley, William Nalley
 February 15, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> February 15, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1927
Sycamore Valley
 
, 1906
  In memory of Zachariah S. Nalley
He was born in Belmont County, Ohio, July 1,1818, and came with his parents to Monroe County, Ohio, A.D. 1831. Died March 14, A.D. 1906, aged 87 years eight months and thirteen days. He was a member of The Mosse Ridge U. B. Church and died in full triumph of the Christian faith. He was married twice; first to Sarah A. Moose, at about the age of fifteen years. To this union were born six children, three boys and three girls, the oldest being 72 years of age. Married Elizabeth  W. Keyser, his second wife in 1847. To this union were born ten children, six boys and four girls. His second wife died about  nine years ago. Mr. Nalley was the father of sixteen children, grandfather of of 85 children, great grandfather of 57 children and the great-great grandfather of seven children. Two of his children preceded him. The funeral services were conducted by T.W. Bishop, leader of The Moose Ridge U.B. Church. The remains were laid to rest in The Moose Ridge Cemetery to await general ressurection.  W.K.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, April  12,1906
 
Nauer, George
Died: February 21, 1927. Source: Monroe County death records
 
Nauer, Gertrude--Nau
Source--News Clipping
 Published--(No Date)
 On Saturday morning, August twenty-fifth, at ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Published--(No Date)
On Saturday morning, August twenty-fifth, at >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 nine o'clock, Miss Gertrude Nauer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Nauer, of Lewisville, became the bride of Richard Nau, son of Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Nau, of Dexter City.
                              >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Saint Joseph's Church, Burkhart, was the scene of the wedding with the pastor, Reverend Joseph Finan, reading the double ring ceremony.
                              Miss Nauer chose ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Miss Nauer chose >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 a gown of white satin styled with a basque bodice, fastening in the back with self-covered buttons and a small mandarin collar. The yoke was outlined with seed pearls and the skirt terminated into an extremely long train. She wore a circular veil of nylon, lace trimmed, caught to a seeded pearl headdress. She carried a prayer book topped with an orchid with ivy and satin streamers .
                              Mrs. Lucille Michel was her sister's matron of honor. She wore a bud green satin gown fashioned with  a marquisette yoke which ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mrs. Lucille Michel was her sister's matron of honor. She wore a bud green satin gown fashioned with a marquisette yoke which >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was edged with inserts of lace trimmed ruffle. The skirt was styled with inserts from the waist to the hemline. She carried a colonial bouquet.
                              Richard Michel ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Richard Michel >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was best man for Mr. Nau.
                              The bride's ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride's >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mother chose a navy blue dress with navy accessories. Mrs. Nau wore gray with black accessories. Both wore corsages of pink and white carnations.
                              A dinner was ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A dinner was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 served at the home of the bride's parents following the ceremony to a number of relatives and friends.
                              The new Mr. and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The new Mr. and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Mrs. Nau are residing in Caldwell where he is employed.
 
 
Nauer, Josephine Weisend
       Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Josephine Weisend, 82, of Lewisville, Route 1, died of a heart condition at seven o'clock Saturday morning, December 30, 1967, at her home.
       Born December 24,1885, at Burkhart, Born December 24,1885, at Burkhart, >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Monroe County, Ohio, she was the daughter of the late John and Emma Knoch Nauer.
       Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Weisend was a member of St. Joseph's Catholic Church, Burkhart.
       Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Hilda Zwick, of Canton;  Mrs. Rita Gallagher, of Quaker City, Route 4,  and Mrs. Mary Eschliman of Massillon;  three sons, Harold J. Weisend of the home;  Lyle Weisend, of Lewisville, Route 1, and  Neil Weisend of Woodsfield;  two sisters, Mrs. Marcella Weisend, of Zanesville, and  Mrs. Celia Block, of Cleveland;  one brother, John ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Hilda Zwick, of Canton; Mrs. Rita Gallagher, of Quaker City, Route 4, and Mrs. Mary Eschliman of Massillon; three sons, Harold J. Her husband Clem G. Weisend, died December 2,1955; one daughter, Emma, died when a small child , and one son, Paul, died December 8, 1964.

Nease, Woodrow II
Source--Times <<<<<<< HEAD Leader   Martins Ferry, Martins Ferry, >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Ohio
 Published--February 19, 2005
Nease , Woodrow W.  II, 48, of Clarington, died Friday February 18, 2005, at his home. He was born September  13, 1956, in Published--February 19, 2005
Nease , Woodrow W. II, 48, of Clarington, died Friday February 18, 2005, at his home. He was born September 13, 1956, in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Huntington, West Virginia, a son of the late Woodrow W. and Rachel Bennett Nease. He was a UMWA construction worker and a home health aid. He was preceded in death by two brothers, Terry Nease and Jerry Nease. Surviving are his wife, Betty McIntire Nease of Clarington; one son, Woodrow W. Nease III of the home; two daughters, Heather Harmon, and her husband, Ronnie, of Sardis, and Shanna Snyder, and her husband, Edward, of Clarington; one brother, Barry Nease, and his wife, Vicki, of South Point, Ohio; one sister, Cora P. Allen, and her husband, Jerry, of Huntington; and six grandchildren, Karah, Madison, Stephanie, Bailey, Natalie and Rally. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. on Sunday at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home in Woodsfield, where services will be held at 11 a.m. on Monday, February 21, 2005, with Minister Sam Bartrug officiating. Interment will be in the Witten Cemetery near Sardis.

 Neff. Danny E.
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Neff. Danny E. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--August 24, 2004
            Danny ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Danny >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 E. Neff, age 77, of New Martinsville, W. Va. died Tuesday August 24, 2004 in Wheeling Hospital, Wheeling, W Va.
He was born April 6, 1927, the son of the late Emery N. and Clara Belle Richmond Neff.
He retired from Quaker State Oil Refinery, a farmer and was a member of the Church of the Nazarene of New Martinsville.
He was preceded in death by parents, his first wife Geraldine Rice Neff, one brother, Russell Neff and one sister, Audra Neff Miller.
Survivors include his wife Lucille Wright Neff; two daughters, Mildred G. (Bud) Bassett, and Mary Jane Neff, one son Michael E. (MaryBeth) Neff, all of Elk Fork W Va.; four step-daughters, Connie Wright of Clarington, Ohio, Rhonda (Dave) Davis of California, Terri (Stephen) Allar of Colerain, Ohio, Pamela (Kenneth) Boley of Clarington; one step-son Gary (Natura) Wright of Dalton, Ohio, three brothers; John (Ruby) Neff of Weirton, Ray Neff of Middlebourne, W Va, Charles (Shirley) Neff of Elk Fork, five grandchildren; twelve step-grandchildren, one great-grandson, five step-great-grandchildren, several nieces and nephews.
Family will receive friends on Thursday 2-4 and 7-9 at Grisell Funeral Home & Crematory, 751 Third Street, New Martinsville. Funeral Services will be held at the Church of the Nazarene, Maple and Virginia Avenues, New Martinsville, at 1pm with Rev. Jerry Boron officiating. Interment will be at Middlebourne Cemetery, Middlebourne, W Va.
Sympathy expressions to www.grisellfuneralhomes.com

Neibch, Annie M.
Source--Monroe County Beacon   Woodsfield, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio
Published--October 1, 1987
            Annie ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Annie >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 M. Neibch,91, of 45795 State Route 145, Lewisville, died September 22 at her home. She was born near Lewisville, August 19, 1896, a daughter of the late Henry and Catherine Kahrig Kilburn. She was a member of the Trinity United Church of Christ near Lewisville.
Mrs. Neibch was preceded in death by her first husband, LeRoy Claus and her second husband, Edwin Neibch, along with two brothers, Charles and Homer Kilburn.
Surviving are two sons, Bernard Claus of Kent, Washington and Floyd Claus of Salem; one daughter, Elvira Claus Stimpert of Lewisville; five grandchildren; and nine great-grandchildren.
Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield September 25 where funeral services were held at 1 p.m. September 26 with Doctor Reverend Gary Wilson of the Trinity United Church of Christ officiating. Burial followed in the Middle Church Cemetery near Lewisville. Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association or to the American Cancer Society.

Neibch, Mrs. Chloe S.
Published---1911 
   has again ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Published---1911
has again >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 entered a family circle and has taken away the soul of a dear mother. Mrs. Chloe S. Neibch, one of our best citizens.
  Mrs. Neibch ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Neibch >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born in Summit Township, Monroe County, Ohio, March 2, 1872. She has been in our midst her entire life and has proven her loyalty to church and as a citizen. She was loved and respected by all who knew her. She was a member of The M.P. Church of this place, and lived a consistant member until her , which occured November 7, 1911, from a relpse of typhoid fever. She attained an age of 39 years,8 months and 5 days.
  She leaves a ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She leaves a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband and two children, a boy and girl, a father, Henry Dillon, a brother and sister, Mrs. Jennie Pickens of Ethel and John R. Dillon of Beverly, Ohio, and a host of relatives and friends to mourn her untimely . Her son, George preceded her some years ago to the better land.
  The funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held Thursday morning, November 9, 1911; the sermon was delivered in The Evangelical Church; Rev. W.J. Eastlake and Rev. H.C. Klutey officiating. Interment in Lewisville Cemetery.
  A host of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A host of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 friends join in sending sympathy to the bereaved family. Those who attended the funeral from a distance were: Mr. and Mrs. Fred Matz, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Matz, Richard and Stephen Clegg and William Friday of Barnesville.

Neibch, Dortha Baker
 Born: March 22, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Born: March 22, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1846 Summit, Died: September 18, 1930, residemce: Summit twp.

DEATH
Name: Dortha Neibch, nee Baker
Source:St. <<<<<<< HEAD Johns Church ======= John s Church >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 records
and The Spirit of Democracy
Issue: Woodsfield, Ohio, September 1930
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 Mrs. Dortha ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Dortha >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Neibch was born in Summit township, Monroe County, Ohio on March 22, 1846, and died September 18, 1930, at her home in Summit township, Monroe County, near Lewisville, Ohio. Daughter of Jacob and Elisabeth Jacky Becker. She had attained the age of 84 years, 5 months, and 26 days. On July 24, 1866, she was united in marriage to Philip Neibch. To this union were born ten children, three having preceded her in infancy.
 Those surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Those surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 her are her aged husband, and seven children: Mrs. Fred Matz, Mrs. Mary Matz, Johnnie Neibch and Elmer Neibch, all of Lewisville, Ohio; Mrs. Katie Clary, of Quaker City, Ohio; Philip Neibch and Miss Matilda Neibch of the home; also nine grandchildren; one brother, Fred Baker, of canton, Ohio; one half-brother, Casper Baker, of Unionville, Ohio. Three sisters and two brothers have preceded her to the Great Beyond.
 Mrs. Neibch was baptized and confirmed in the faith of the St. Johns Evangelical ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Neibch was baptized and confirmed in the faith of the St. John s Evangelical >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church of which she remained a consistent member until death.
 She was kind, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was kind, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 true and a beloved wife and mother, and she will be sadly missed in her home by relatives, friends, and neighbors who knew her.
 On September 21st she was laid to rest in the St. Johns ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On September 21st she was laid to rest in the St. John s >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Middle Church cemetery in Summit township. Funeral services were conducted by the Reverend Yoho of Belle Valley, Ohio.
 May she rest in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May she rest in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 peace where there will be no more pain and sorrow. We shall meet her again in the Eternal home never to part.
 
Neibch, Edwin Carl
Source--News Clipping
Published--1955
Neibch, Edwin Carl, was born near Monroefield, on November 18, 1887, the son of John and Louisa Bintz Neibch. He departed this life at his home on February 1, 1955 at the age of 67 years and two months.
He lived his entire life in the Monroefield community and was a lifelong member of Saint John's Evangelical and Reformed Church where he was baptized and confirmed in his youth. He also served in the United States Armed Forces in World War 1.
On April 16, 1951 he was united in marriage with Mrs. Anna Claus. He is survivied by his wife; four sisters, Mrs. Clarence Weber and Miss Luella Neibch of near Woodsfield, Mrs. Leona LaFollette, of Akron and Mrs. Lydia Bailer of Cleveland; three step-children, Alvira Claus, of Barnesville; Floyd Claus, of Salem, Ohio and Bernard Claus of Wichita, Kansas.
All his life Edwin was a hardworking farmer, first on his parents farm where he lived with his mother and sister and then continuing on his own farm where he lived with his wife. He loved to farm and to tend his cattle, to watch things grow and to be in the out-of-doors.
Short services were held in the Bauer and Turner Funeral Chapel on Friday afternoon at one o'clock. Additional services were held at two o'clock in Saint John's (Middle Church) Evangelical and Reformed Church. Reverend George W. Varnes officiated. Interment was in the church cemetery. Military rites were accorded by Monroe <<<<<<< HEAD Post Number  87, American Legion.
 
======= Post Number 87, American Legion.
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
You who are born of the hills,
        Hill-bred,  lover of hills,
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Hill-bred, lover of hills, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Though the world may not treat you allright,
        Though ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Though >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 your soul be weary with ills;
This will you know above other men,
        In the hills, you will find peace again.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In the hills, you will find peace again.
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Note of Thanks- To all those who were a comfort and help during the recent death of my beloved husband, to the friends in the neighborhood, to Mr. Paul Turner, for his kindness, to the American Legion for their service, to Reverend Varnes for his comforting words, and for the many beautiful flowers,my deepest thanks and appreciation
to all.  Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>to all. Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Edwin Neibch & Family
 
Neibch, Mrs. Elizabeth
Published---1938
  Mrs. Elizabeth ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Elizabeth >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Neibch, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Philip Neibch, was born in Malaga Township on June 26, 1868, and died November 29, 1938, at the home of her nephew, William Matz, near Lewisville, Ohio. She attained the age of 70 years, 5 months and 3 days.
  On March 19, 1902, she was united in marriage ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On March 19, 1902, she was united in marriage >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 with Fred Matz and this union was blessed with one son, Frank. Her husband preceded her in on May 11, 1934 and her son on December 16, 1914.
  Surviving are ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 three brothers and three sisters, John W. Neibch, Philip Neibch, Elmer Neibch, Mrs. Mary Matz and Miss Matilda Neibch, all of Lewisville, and Mrs. Katie Clary, of Quaker City. A host of other relatives and friends also survive.
  Mrs. Matz was ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. Matz was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 baptized and confirmed in The Evangelical faith at Middle Church and lived a consistant faithful member until . She was a kind, true and beloved wife and sister and not only will be sadly missed in her home but by all her relatives, friends and neighbors.
  Funeral ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 services were held on December 2, 1938, Rev. Wm. R. Walch, of Lewisville officiating, She was laid to rest in Oak Lawn Cemetery in Woodsfield.
  May she rest ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> May she rest >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 in peace, where there is no more pain or sorrow, till we shall meet her again in The Eternal home never more to part.
 
     " Tis hard to break the tender cord
      When love has bound the hearts;
     "Tis hard, so hard, to speak the words
      We must forever part.
 
      Dearest loved one, we must lay thee
      In the peaceful grave's embrace,
      But thy memory will be cherished
      Til we see thy heavenly face.
 
      Peaceful be thy silent slumber,
      Peaceful in thy grave so low;
      Thou no more will join our number,
      Thou no more our sorrow know.
 
      Yet, again, we hope to meet thee
      When the day of life is fled;
      And in Heaven with joy to greet thee
      Where no farewell tears are shed.
 Card of Thanks
  We herby ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
" Tis hard to break the tender cord
When love has bound the hearts;
"Tis hard, so hard, to speak the words
We must forever part.
Dearest loved one, we must lay thee
In the peaceful grave's embrace,
But thy memory will be cherished
Til we see thy heavenly face.
Peaceful be thy silent slumber,
Peaceful in thy grave so low;
Thou no more will join our number,
Thou no more our sorrow know.
Yet, again, we hope to meet thee
When the day of life is fled;
And in Heaven with joy to greet thee
Where no farewell tears are shed.
Card of Thanks
We herby >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 express our appreciation for the many kindnesses shown by our neighbors and friends during the illness and at the time of the of our dear sister. We also wish to thank Rev. Wm.R. Walch for his consoling words and the choir.

Neibch, John
 June 4, 1855 Malaga
 September 30, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> June 4, 1855 Malaga
September 30, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1930
Malaga twp.
The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Wed., October 15, 1930
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 Death which so ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Death which so >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 often and unexpectedly enters our homes and community, recently has taken from us a husband and father Mr. John Neibch, of Lewisville, Ohio. Mr. Neibch took sick September 12th being ill from arterial sclerosis and all that human aid and neighborly love could do was done, but God knew best, and he was called to enter the Heavenly home.
 The deceased ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The deceased >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born June 4th, 1855, and died September 30th, 1930 in Malaga township, being at the time of death 75 years, 3 months and 25 days old. He was the son of Johann Georg and Anna Maria Schafer Neibch. On April 17, 1881 he was united in marriage to Louisa Bintz and to this union eight children were born. Three preceded him in their early youth, Benjamin J., Benjamin H. and Pauline; five children are still living: Lydia Bailey of Cleveland, Ohio; Emma Weber of Woodsfield, Ohio; Leona Lafollette of Akron, Ohio; Luella and Edwin of the home. He is also survived by one brother, Philip Neibch of Lewisville and two grandchildren, Mildred Bailey and Kenneth Lafollette. He was a good father, always ready to help in time of need and trouble. He gained and kept the respect of all who ever knew him and will be sadly missed from our midst. His body was laid to rest in the family lot at St. Johns Middle Church on October 2nd.
 Mr. Neibch was ======= w:st="on">St. John s Middle Church on October 2nd.
Mr. Neibch was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 confirmed and joined the Evangelical Church at the age of 15 years and he was a faithful member all of his life. The funeral services were conducted by his pastor, the Reverend Edward Brueseke, of Lewisville, who choose for his text He is not dead by sleepeth.
 
======= w:st="on">Lewisville, who choose for his text He is not dead by sleepeth.

Neibch, Lillie Audra (nee Schaub)

February 25, 1965

DEATH

Lillie Audra Neibch

   Mrs. Lillie Audra Neibch, 2, of Mrs. Lillie Audra Neibch, 2, of >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Lewisville, died Friday afternoon, February 19, 1965, at 4:30 o'clock at her home after a few days illness.

   She was born on March 3, 1892, ======= JA'> She was born on March 3, 1892, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 near Lewisville the daughter of Andrew and Sarah Groves Schaub.

   Surviving are one daughter, Miss ======= JA'> Surviving are one daughter, Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lavinda Neibch, of the home; three sisters, Mrs. W. F. Matz, of Woodsfield; Mrs. Angie Steeh, of Wooster, and Mrs. Pearl Stewart, of Cambridge. Her husband Elmer Neibch, died in September 1963.

   Funeral services were held Monday ======= JA'> Funeral services were held Monday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon at two o'clock in the Bauer and Turner Funeral Chapel with Rev. Lester E. Flauhaus, of Greentown, Ohio officiating. Burial was in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville.

Source--Monroe County Beacon    Woodsfield, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Woodsfield, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio

            Luella H. Neibch, 90, of Luella H. Neibch, 90, of >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">114 South Paul Street, Woodsfield, died September 26, 1987 at Barnesville Hospital. She was born January 3, 1897 in Monroe County, the daughter of the late John and Louisa Bintz Neibch.
She was a member of the Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville.
She was preceded in death by one brother and three sisters.
Surviving are one sister, Leona Lafollette, of Saginaw, Michigan; one neice Mildred Weishampel of Avon Lake; also several great-nieces and nephews.
Friends were received at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held September 28 with Reverend Gary Wilson of the Trinity United Church of Christ of Lewisville officiating.  Hulda L. Neisz ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Hulda L. Neisz >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born July 27, 1887, in Malaga township, Monroe County, Ohio; White; female; father, Henry Neisz; mother, Magdalena Bintz; residence of parents, Malaga township.
 
Neisz, Mrs. John (nee Egger)
               Mrs. John Neisz, nee Egger, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. John Neisz, nee Egger, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 dropped dead at her home at Monroefield, Ohio Monday evening, July 11, 1904. Mrs. Neisz was in her usual health and had attended the funeral of Mr. Frederick KETTERER at Miltonsburg in the afternoon. She returned home and was preparing the evening meal when she commenced feeling ill and called to her daughter-in-law saying she believed she was going to die. She had scarcely pronounced the words when she fell to the floor and expired in a few minutes, not uttering another word. Her husband was absent from home and arrived in about half an hour and was greatly shocked to find his companion cold in . Deceased was 54 years of age. She leaves a devoted husband, one son, and one daughter; also an aged mother, seven brothers and 4 sisters. She was the oldest of a family of 13 children of whom the first and the youngest died two years ago. Two brothers, Mr. John H. Egger and Mrs. S. W. Egger and two sisters, Mrs. Henry Neuhart and Mrs. Will HAWKINS reside in Woodsfield. The funeral took place Wednesday afternoon, services being held at the German M. E. Church of which she was a faithful and consistent member for more than 30 years.
Source: The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., July 14, 1904
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig

Nelson, Rosen, Annie, nee Nelson
Source--The Times Leader    Martins Ferry, Martins Ferry, >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Ohio
Published- August, 2004     
======= 1'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Annie Darrah Rosen, 88, formerly of Powhatan Point, Ohio, died Saturday, Aug. 28, 2004, at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center, Woodsfield, Ohio. She was born May 14, 1916, in Crescent, Ohio, a daughter of the late Pomeroy and Addelia Bruce Nelson.  She was a former employee at the Company ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She was a former employee at the Company >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Store for North American Coal Company #1 Mine at Powhatan Point and a member of the Amity United Methodist Church in Steinersville, Ohio.                                                                              In addition ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In addition >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Charlie Darrah; four sisters, Mabel Jennewein, Lula Keene, Mildred Townson, and Ellen Vostatek; and three brothers, Willard Nelson, Clyde Nelson and Albert Nelson. Surviving are her daughter, Priscilla Jeffers and her husband, Joe, of Jacobsburg, Ohio; a son, Austin Darrah of Powhatan Point; a sister, Edna Ramsey of Powhatan Point; and two grandchildren, Carri Darrah and Casey Darrah. Family and friends will be received on Monday from 2 to 8 p.m. at Toothman Funeral Home in Jacobsburg, where services will be held on Tuesday, Aug. 31, 2004, at 11 a.m., with Pastor Lorna Knight officiating. Burial will follow at Powhatan Cemetery, Powhatan Point, Ohio. Memorial contributions may be made to the Alzheimer's Association, 225 N. Michigan Ave., Ste 1700, Chicago, IL 60601-7633 <<<<<<< HEAD or online at www.alz.org.  
======= or online at www.alz.org. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Nelson, Larry, Sr.
            Larry ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Larry >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 E. Nelson Sr., 54, of 44534 State Route 800, Woodsfield, Ohio died at 6:25 a.m., Tuesday, November. 16, 2004 at the Camden-Clark Memorial Hospital, Parkersburg, West Virginia.
He was born at Bellaire, Ohio on May 16, 1950, a son of Richard Eugene Nelson who survives of Bellaire, Ohio and the late Ida Shirley Trigg Nelson.
He was a former coal miner for North American Coal Company #4 Mine, Clarington, Ohio and was an employee of Wal-Mart, Cambridge, Ohio. He was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ, Woodsfield, a U.S. Army veteran of the Vietnam War, a member of V.F.W. Post 5303, Woodsfield, Ohio.
In addition to his mother, he was preceded in death by an infant sister, Judy Nelson; one brother, Doug Nelson and one nephew, Ronnie Nelson.
Surviving in addition to his father are his wife, Sylvia Rowley Nelson whom he married on Dec. 14, 1974; one daughter, Tillie Moore and husband, John of Letart, W. Va.; three sons, Bill Leonard of Letart, W. Va.; Larry Nelson Jr. and wife, Robin, of Woodsfield, Ohio and Shane Nelson of Summerville, S.C.; two sisters, Patty Nelson of Bellaire, and Kim Bowles and husband, Charlie, of Rayland, one brother, Steve Nelson of Bellaire; one granddaughter, Taylor Nicole Nelson of Woodsfield, Ohio; several nieces and nephews.
Friends will be received at Watters Funeral Home, 37501 State Route 78 West, Woodsfield, from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m., Thursday, where funeral services will be held at 1 p.m., Friday with Sam Bartrug officiating.
Burial will follow in the Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield, with full military graveside services by the Belmont Veterans Council.
Source: Times Recorder, Wednesday, November 17, 2004.

Neuhardt, Mr. Arthur F. and Miss Bertha Christman

Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., May 10, 1917
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
               Mr. Arthur F. NEUHARDT and Miss ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Arthur F. NEUHARDT and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Bertha CHRISTMAN were married May 1,1917 by the Rev. A. H. Knipping.
 
Neuhart, Catharine (nee Schaub) [Source:The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., May 8, 1890]
                Mrs. Catharine Neuhart, nee Schaub, a native ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mrs. Catharine Neuhart, nee Schaub, a native >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Prussia, Germany, was born on the 24th of February 1823. She immigrated to this country in 1835, and made her home in Summit township, Monroe County, Ohio. On the 24th day of May 1842, she was married to Mr. John Michael Neuhart. Eleven children were given to them in this marriage, of whom 10 follow the mother to the grave. One has preceded her into eternity by . Three months ago she went to Wheeling to attend to the wants of her sick daughter, Amelia, after whose convalescence, she Started on her way home. While on the train, she became very sick, and upon arriving in Woodsfield, she was laid upon her fatal bed of illness and for four weeks she suffered until released by . Her occurred on Sunday morning, May 4, 1890, thus reaching the age of 67 years, 2 months, and 10 days. She suffered from a contracted cold, which finally resulted in typhoid fever. On Sunday morning, she had a stroke of paralysis from the effects of which she passed from time to eternity. She has been a consistent member of the German M. E. Church, and remained as such until her , from which she now has entered into her reWard. She leaves hosts of relatives and friends who feel keenly the loss they have sustained. The number of those present at the funeral shows to what extent she was esteemed and respected in her social surroundings. Although dark, stormy, rainy clouds hover over head all day and finally the rain poured down in heavy showers. Friends and relatives gathered together from far and near to pay the last honors of love and friendship to her. She died a Christian and as we believe in the training of faith, God bless the bereaved ones and heal their <<<<<<< HEAD wounded hearts.  F.
======= wounded hearts. F. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711

Neuhart, Mrs. Frank
Funeral services were held Friday afternoon at the home near Batesville for Mrs. Frank Neuhart, 60, a life-long resident of Noble County.  Services were in charge of Rev. A. A. Gilmore ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Services were in charge of Rev. A. A. Gilmore >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and interment was made at Friends Cemetery.
  She was married in 1890,  her maiden name being Leach.  Her husband and the following children survive;  Forest A. and William O. Neuhart and Mrs. G. F. McPeek, Batesville;  Mrs. Carlos Eshbaugh, Eldon;  Mrs. Charles Betts, Freeport; and Gladys of the home.  She also leaves five brothers, one sister and 17 grandchildren.  One brother, a sister and one grandchild preceded her in death.  Friday 27 April 1934 Quaker City Home Towner.

Neuhart, Miss Harriette M.
               It is with a sadness we record ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> It is with a sadness we record >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the of our beloved friend Miss Harriette Magdalina Neuhardt, of Summit township, Monroe County, Ohio, departed this life March 3, 1911, at an early age of 13 years, 7 months, and 3 days. She was born August 1, 1897. Harriette was a bright intelligent young girl loved by all who knew her. Her sweet disposition and sunny temper helped her find the way into the hearts of may friends. She had been ill about a week with lagrippe. Everything that loving hands could do was done but no one had power over the spirit to retain it, and it took its flight to the heavenly city Friday afternoon. She leaves father and mother, James Jacob and Lucetta Bintz Neuhardt; one sister, Mrs. Charles (Charlotte) SLOAN of Miltonsburg; two brothers, Franklin Neuhardt of Hornick, Iowa and Arthur Neuhardt at home. Her sister Clara Neuhardt preceded her to the better land on January 4, 1894. She was laid to rest Sunday at the German M. E. Church near Monroefield, Ohio. May she rest in peace.    A cousin.
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> A cousin. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, March 30, 1911
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
 
 
Lillian E. Neuhart, 84, of Old Washington, died at 5:10 P.M. Saturday (February 21, 1987) at her home following a Long illness.
 She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 March 3, 1902, in Calais, the daughter of Spencer and Loubertha Atkinson Carpenter. Mrs. Neuhart was a Methodist by faith.
 She leaves her ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She leaves her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 husband, Bert, who she married in August 1920; three daughters, Mrs. Oscar (Helen) Baker of the Freeport area, Marjorie Kuhnash of Burlington, Iowa and Patsy Smith of Cambridge; three sons, Earl Neuhart of the Quaker City area, Kenneth and Jackie Neuhart, both of Old Washington; three sisters, Sally Miller of Quaker City, Thelma Kane of Arizona and Edrie Marguntie of California; 24 grandchildren, 25 great-grandchildren and one great-great-grandchild.
 One sister, three brothers, two grandchildren and one great-grandchild preceded her in .
 Friends may ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> One sister, three brothers, two grandchildren and one great-grandchild preceded her in .
Friends may >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 P.M. today at Bundy-Law Funeral Home, where services will be at 1 P.M. Tuesday with the Rev. Donald Legg officiating. Burial will be in Guernsey Memory Gardens. Monday 23 February 1987 Jeffersonian.
 
 
Neuhardt, Richard J.
July 21, 1922
March 8, 2000
Lewisville

Thursday, March 16, 2000

Monroe County Beacon, Woodsfield, Ohio, p. 5

Richard Neuhardt

     Richard J. Neuhardt, 77, of Lewisville, died March 8, 2000 at the Ohio Valley Medical Center, Wheeling.  He was born in Richard J. Neuhardt, 77, of Lewisville, died March 8, 2000 at the Ohio Valley Medical Center, Wheeling. He was born in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Monroe County, July 21, 1922, son of the late Arthur Neuhardt and Bertha Christman Neuhardt.

     He was a Navy veteran of WW II, serving in ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> He was a Navy veteran of WW II, serving in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the Pacific for four years, he farmed, and retired from Ormet Corp., Hannibal. He was a member of the Trinity United Church of Christ, Lewisville, and a member of the Masonic Lodge of Woodsfield.

     Surviving are two sisters and ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Surviving are two sisters and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 brothers-in-law, Mrs. Charles (Nadine) Knowlton, Reynoldsburg, Mrs. Max (Delys) Bodenhausen, Highlandville, Mo.; a brother and sister-in-law, Vernon Neuhardt and his wife, Beverly, Wooster; 11 nieces and nephews.

     In addition to his parents, he was ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> In addition to his parents, he was >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 preceded in death by a sister, Marie Green.

     Friends were received March 11 until time of  services at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, with Rev. William Worcester officiating.  Interment in Friends were received March 11 until time of services at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, with Rev. William Worcester officiating. Interment in >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Oaklawn Cemetery, Woodsfield.

Neuhart, Frederick Charles
               Frederick Charles Neuhart, a prominent citizen of Summit township, died suddenly Monday afternoon, May 14, 1907. Burial in St. Johns Frederick Charles Neuhart, a prominent citizen of Summit township, died suddenly Monday afternoon, May 14, 1907. Burial in St. John s >>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 w:st="on">Middle Church cemetery. He had been engaged in assessing this township and had almost completed his work when he was taken ill. Frederick was born May 23, 1858, the son of Heinrich Michael Neuhart and Johanna Sophia ADEL. Frederick married Maria Elisabeth WEBER, who died April 1, 1900, the daughter of C. C. WEBER and Salome Meckling WEBER.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, May 16, 1907
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig

Neuhart, Timmons, Gladys L., nee Neuhart
Source--Barnesville Enterprise     Barnesville, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Barnesville, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ohio
Published--February 18, 2004
            Gladys ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Gladys >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lucille Timmons, 86, of Barnesville, died Friday, February 13, 2004 at Barnesville, Ohio.
She was born February 12, 1918, in Calais, the daughter of the late William Franklin and Stella (Leach) Neuhart.
She was a member and former member of the Somerton school board and a member of the Mulberry Twig.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by two brothers, Jim and Wiley Neuhart; and three sisters, Shirley McPeek, Sally Eschbaugh and Mary Betts Bowles.
She leaves her husband of 67 years, Charles R. "Dick" Timmons; a son, Steve (Shirley) Timmons of Senecaville; two daughters, Myrna (Ed) Talbott of Fort Mitchell, Kentucky and Connie (Ron) Wyscarver of Galena; 11 grandchildren, 22 great-grandchildren and two great-great-grandchildren.
Friends were received at the Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, 319 North Chestnut Street, Barnesville, where services were held on Monday.
Burial followed in Friends Cemetery.
Memorials can be made to the American Cancer Society.

Neuhart, Jacob
               Jacob Neuhart, aged 66 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Jacob Neuhart, aged 66 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died at his home in Barnesville, Ohio January 31, 1916, from pneumonia. Deceased was born in Woodsfield and grew to manhood at this place. He leaves a wife and one daughter and the following brothers and sisters: Fritz and Charles Neuhart of Woodsfield, William Neuhart of Pittsburgh, Elwood, Philip, Ernest and George Neuhart of Western states, Mrs. Louise SNYDER of Woodsfield and Mrs. Mary STOEHR of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

Neuhardt, james Jacob
            It is with sadness we are called upon ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> It is with sadness we are called upon >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 to note the departure of our friend and neighbor, James Jacob Neuhardt, son of John Michael and Mary Catherine Schaub NEUHART. John Michael died September 11, 1909, in Monroe County, Ohio and Mary Catherine died in 1890. James Jacob was born August 1, 1857, at the Neuhardt homestead in Summit township, Monroe County, Ohio, and departed this life July 9, 1922, at the Good Samaritan Hospital, Zanesville, Ohio. On Sunday, November 12, 1885, he was married to Miss Lucetta Bintz. To this union were born five children of which two daughters, Clara Lucetta and Harriett Magdelina gone to the world beyond. Harriett Magdelina Neuhardt died March 3, 1911.
 Just a week ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Just a week >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 before he passed away he seemed to be enjoying life as usual when suddenly on Sunday afternoon, July 2, he was stricken ill. His case was placed in the physician and upon his advice it was deemed best to go to the hospital where he was placed in the hands of the surgeons. Although his condition was serious they thought it best to try the gallstone operation. This for a time seemed to be successful, then uremic poisoning set in which resulted in his death. Before he Started to the hospital, he expressed the thought that perhaps he might never return but was ready to face death. He was accompanied by his faithful wife, who at his request never left him until the end came.
 On Sunday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> On Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 afternoon, July 2, the body was brought from Zanesville to the home to await the funeral services which were held in the German M. E. Church near Monroefield, Ohio, on Wednesday morning, July 12, and the remains were laid to rest in the cemetery therein the presence of a large number of friends and relatives. The services were conducted by the Reverend Theodore LAGFEMANN of Hopkins, Michigan, a former pastor and friend.
 He was a kind husband and devoted father and he will be sadly missed in the home and in the community in which he has spent his life, but we can only say Thy will, Lord, and not ours be done.
 He leaves to ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> He was a kind husband and devoted father and he will be sadly missed in the home and in the community in which he has spent his life, but we can only say Thy will, Lord, and not ours be done.
He leaves to >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 mourn his loss, his beloved wife, Lucetta Bintz Neuhardt, three children, Franklin Samuel Neuhardt and Arthur Frederick Neuhardt of near Lewisville and Mrs. Charlotte Amelia Neuhardt SLOAN of Miltonsburg; three grandchildren, two brothers, George E. Neuhardt of Memphis, Tennessee, and Henry J. Neuhardt of Moundsville, West Virginia; five sisters, Mary and Elizabeth Neuhardt and Katherine HARRIGON of Barnesville, Mrs. Ernestine Thompson of Shadyside, Amelia Neuhardt of Wheeling, West Virginia, and Mrs. Mollie DINZER who spent a portion of her life in the Neuhardt home. Two brothers, Philip Neuhardt of Barnesville, Ohio and John Neuhardt of Lukee, Mississippi have gone before. Besides these there are numerous other relatives and friends who will sadly miss him from our midst. To all these, we extend our heartfelt sympathy and may all look to our <<<<<<< HEAD Heavenly Father for help and guidance throughout lifes pathway.
======= Heavenly Father for help and guidance throughout life s pathway. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, August 3, 1922
From the collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig

Nichols, Esther G. Nichols, nee Rohrbach
 
SOURCE: Daily Jeffersonian . . Cambridge, OH . . 27 Jul 2001 . .
 
BARNESVILLE  Esther G. Nichols, 86, of Pickerington, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>BARNESVILLE Esther G. Nichols, 86, of Pickerington, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 formerly of Barnesville, died Wednesday (July 25, 2001) in Columbus.
She was born May 8, 1915, in Ozark, daughter of the late Samuel and Eva Elizabeth Ricer Rohrbach.
 
She was preceded in death by her husband, Harry W. Nichols; an infant son; a stepson, Clarence Nichols; two brothers, Ernest and Ralph Rohrbach; a sister, Freda Moore.
She leaves two daughters, Edna Luke of Somerton and Margaret Ann Kyer of Pickerington; a stepson, Virgil Nichols of East Canton; four grandchildren; six great-grandchildren; nine step-grandchildren; and several step-great-grandchildren.
 
Graveside services will be 11 a.m. Saturday in Ebenezer Cemetery, Bethesda, with the Rev. Ed Eberhart officiating.
Arrangements are being handled by Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home, Barnesville.
Memorial contributions may be made to First Christian Church or First United Methodist Church, both of Barnesville.

Nickerson, Cecil Glen                                                                             Source--Marietta Times    Marietta, Ohio                                                         ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Source--Marietta Times Marietta, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Published--September 23, 2004
 
NEW MATAMORAS - Cecil Glen Nickerson, 65, of 33223 State Route 800, New Matamoras, died at 8:11 p.m. Tuesday , September, 21, 2004 at Marietta Memorial Hospital. He was born March 8, 1939, in Wheeling, West Virginia, to Archie Robert and Rachel Clara Kirkbride Nickerson. He was a crane operator for Ormet Corporation at Hannibal, retiring in 1980. He was a Vietnam veteran. He graduated from Tridelphia High School in Wheeling, West Virginia, in 1957. He was a member of American Legion Post 760 at Hannibal, United Steel Workers of America Local 592 and Mountaineer CB Radio Club.He is survived by his wife, Connie Nickerson, whom he married on December 25, 1963; one daughter, Rachel Allen and her fiance, Simon Knotts, of New Matamoras; one grandson, Lawrence "Bubby" Allen of New Matamoras; one granddaughter, Summer Yonley of New Matamoras; and one sister, Teresa McCelland of Groveport, Ohio. He was preceded in death by his parents. Services are at 11 a.m. Friday at Hadley Funeral Home in New Matamoras with the Reverend Frank Conley officiating. Burial is in Matamoras Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at the funeral home. There will be military services at the graveside. Memorial contributions may be made to the Matamoras Emergency Squad.
 
Nieb
Florence Irene West, nee Nieb
Marietta times. august 25, 2004
Florence Irene West, 92, of 614 Masonic Park Road, Marietta, died at 2:25 p.m. Tuesday (Aug. 24, 2004) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
 
She was born July 14, 1912, in Marr, Monroe County, to Jacob J. and Lenora Smithberger Nieb. She was a seamstress for J.C. Penny in Marietta, where she retired in 1977.
She graduated from Bethel High School in 1930. She was a member of St. Paul's Evangelical Church; a 50-year member and a charter member of Masterton Eastern Star Chapter 584; a 50-year member of Waterford Grange 231; and a member of Washington County Farm Bureau Women's Committee and Wolf Creek Farm Bureau Council. She was a Washington County 4-H advisor and a Washington County Election Board poll worker.
 
She is survived by two daughters, Joanne West of Marietta and Charlotte Hendricks and her husband, John, of Marietta; four grandsons, Scott Hendricks and his wife, Jennifer, of Marietta, Todd Hendricks of Marietta, Allen Bookman and his wife, Claire, of Lakewood, Ohio, and Kevin Bookman and his wife, Stephanie, of Marietta; one great-grandson, Oliver Roy Hendricks of Marietta; two stepgreat-grandchildren, Austin and Andrew Hackney; and one sister-in-law, Cecile M. Jeffers of Marietta.
 
On Dec. 23, 1933, she married Roy Jennings West, in Lewisville, Ohio. He died on Sept. 17, 1992. She was also preceded in death by her parents; one daughter, Sandra Bookman, who died on Jan. 5, 1992; and three sisters, Wilma Nieb, Mabel Rohrer and Beulah Williams.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at St. Paul's Evangelical Church, Fifth and Scammel streets, Marietta, with Steve Dennis officiating. Burial is in Valley Cemetery. The family will receive friends from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. Thursday at Hadley Funeral Home, Reno Chapel. There will be Eastern Star services at 8 p.m. Thursday.
 
Memorial contributions may be made to the Devola Volunteer Fire Co.
 
Niebch, John
John Niebch died August 10, 1854. He was born September 9, 1853, the son of John and Elisabeth Neuhardt Niebch.

Niesz, Edna G. (Paulus)
MASSILLON - Edna G. Niesz, 95, of Massillon died Friday (April 2, 2004) at Massillon Community Hospital.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was born Nov. 12, 1908, in Woodsfield to John Anthony and Catherine Jane Latta Paulus. She was retired from the Monroe County Probate Court. Along with her husband, she moved to Massillon after retirement to be near her brother, John. In Massillon, she and her husband worked many years for Morton's of Massillon.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 is survived by numerous nieces and nephews, with special relationships to Ruth Ann Senour of Arizona, Elizabeth Dillen of Wooster, Ohio, Ann Louise Stormer of Philadelphia and Franklin, Keith, John Herbert and James Richard Paulus, all of Massillon; and her sisters-in-law, Anna Lucille Paulus of Massillon and Marguarite Littell of Columbus.
            She ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was preceded in death by her husband, Clarence Niesz, in 2000; two sisters, Ida Paulus Christman and Ethel Paulus Christman; five brothers, Asher, Herbert, Francis, Chester and John Lawrence Paulus; and two nephews, Francis and Emerson Paulus.
            Services ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Services >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are at 2 p.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with the Rev. Lee Peters officiating. Burial is in Friendship Cemetery in Lewisville, Monroe County. Friends will be received from 1 to 2 p.m. Wednesday at the funeral home.
            Memorial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 contributions may be made to her current church, Epworth United Methodist Church, 3061 Lincoln Way West, Massillon, Ohio 44647; or to her hometown church, St. Paul's United Church of Christ, 303 S. Main St., Woodsfield, Ohio 43793.The Daily Jeffersonian, dated Saturday, April 3, 2004

Elmer John Niesz

Elmer died in Malaga township, Monroe County, Ohio of scarlatina. Interment at the German M. E. cemetery, near Monroefield on Sunday, February 25 with the Reverend J. R. Mueller officiating. Niesz, Mary Ackerman         X
            Mrs. Herman Ackerman, nee Mary Niesz, was born in Birmingham, now Pittsburgh, Pa. on June 11, 1843
            At the age of three years, her parents ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Niesz, Mary Ackerman X
Mrs. Herman Ackerman, nee Mary Niesz, was born in Birmingham, now Pittsburgh, Pa. on June 11, 1843
At the age of three years, her parents >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 moved to Monroe County, Ohio and located in Malaga Township where she resided until her death.
            In 1862 she was married to Herman ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> In 1862 she was married to Herman >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ackerman. This union was blessed with seven children; Anna Bintz, John Ackerman and Henry Ackerman of Somerton; Mary Christman of Lewisville; Matilda Seebach of Limaville; Clara Christman of Calais, and Benjamin Ackerman of Donora, Pa. Anna preceded her on March 1, 1896.
            Her husband preceded her on February 27, 1919.
             Mrs. Ackerman died on June 22, 1939, about ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Her husband preceded her on February 27, 1919.
Mrs. Ackerman died on June 22, 1939, about >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 8:30 a.m. at the home of Mrs. Jacob Christman at the age of 96 years and 11 days.
            She leaves to mourn her, besides the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She leaves to mourn her, besides the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 children, the following: twenty-nine grandchildren, sixty-seven great-grandchildren one great-great-grandchild and a host of other relatives and friends.
            Funeral services were held on Sunday ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Funeral services were held on Sunday >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 morning, June 25th, at Middle Church in charge of Rev. W. R. Walch. Burial was made in the Church Cemetery.
Source: Provided by Beryl Christman Claus
 
Nippert, Dustin Dve and Carrie Sue West
Source--Times Leader    ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Source--Times Leader >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--January 17, 2005
West , Carrie Sue  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>West , Carrie Sue >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and Dustin David Nippert were united in marriage at 5:30 p.m., November 20 at Saint John's United Church of Christ, Powhatan Point. Pastor Steve Smith of Newport performed the ceremony. The bride is the daughter of Cameron and Monna West of New Matamoras. The groom's parents are David and Penni Nippert of Beallsville. Meagan Skees was maid of honor; Stacy Nething; matron of honor; and Derik Nippert and Logan Nippert were best men. Other attendants were Shannon West, Lori Smith, Stacey Courtney, Erica Nippert, Janell Harlan, Kelly Tekavec, Heather Morris and Katelyn Smith, junior bridesmaid; Tony Stephen, Cameron West, Jeremy Beardmore, Steve Johnson, Chris Caldwell, Chad Baker, Ryan Coffin, Jason Weekley, Adam Conrad and Jared Doyle. Sidney Boltz was flower girl and Briar West was ring bearer. Guest register was Bonna Lamp. Music for the ceremony was provided by vocalist Rita Gust and organist Paula Frank. A reception followed with music by Dougger Music. The bride is a graduate of Frontier High School and has a bachelor of science degree in elementary education from Ohio Valley College of Parkersburg, West Virginia.  She is employed by Frontier Local School ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> She is employed by Frontier Local School >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 District and Pleasants County School District as a substitute teacher. Her husband is a graduate of Beallsville High School. He is an employed pitcher for the Arizona Diamondbacks Professional Baseball Organization. Following a wedding cruise to the Eastern Caribbean, the couple resides in Tucson, Arizona.

Nolen, Donald Lee
Source--News Clipping
Published--February , 2004
            FAIR BLUFF, NORTH CAROLINA--Donald ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> FAIR BLUFF, NORTH CAROLINA--Donald >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Lee Nolen, 71, of Fair Bluff died Monday, February 9, 2004 at the Durham VA Medical Center in Durham, North Carolina.
He was born April 9, 1932, in Bellaire, Ohio, to William and Ida Bailey Nolen. He was a retired truck driver and was a United States Air Force Veteran of the Korean conflict.
He is survived by his wife, Sara Ellen Morris Nolen; four sons, Steve McNess of Middlebourne, West Virginia, Scott McNess of Baton Rouge, Louisiana, Joseph Morris of Tabor City, North Carolina and Brent Nolen of Marietta; two daughters, Barbara Rush of Thornton, West Virginia and Dianna Watts of Nakina, North Carolina; two brothers, Donald Brunner of Columbus and John Nolen of Tborbul, Austrailia; and 14 grandchildren.
He was preceded in death by his parents; one sister, Margaret A. Parker; and four brothers, Cecil, James, Russell and Richard Nolen.
Graveside services are at 2 p.m. Saturday at High Ridge Cemetery in Bellaire, Ohio. Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Home & Crematory at 441 37th Street, Bellaire, is in charge of arrangements.
 
Nolen, Donald Lee

            Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Hattie Norris, 86, resident of Woodsfield for many years, died Sunday night at the Crawford Nursing Home at Malvern. Her husband, Henry Norris, died in 1960. She was born March 13, 1877, and was a member of the Louisville Church of Christ.
            Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are a daughter, Mrs. Walter Norris of Woodsfield, two sons, Guy Norris of Woodsfiled Route 2 and Herman Horris of Canton; several grandchildren and great-grandchildren, and one great-great-grandchild.

Burial will be in Oaklawn cmetery at Woodsfield. Friends may call after 7 p.m. today at the funeral home.

 Norris, Lester
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Norris, Lester >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Source:Canton (OH) Repository - 29 Sept 2003
            Lester ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Lester >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Norris, age 74, of Canton, OH, passed away on Saturday, September 27, 2003 at Aultman Hospital. Born in Woodsfield, OH, to the late Clarence and Lorena (Baker) Norris. Lester worked for the Timken Company as a truck driver for 30 years before is retirement in 1989. Prior to his work at Timken, Lester served in the U.S. Army where he reached the rank of Private 1st Class and was a World War II Veteran. He was a member of the VFW and the McKinley Eagles 2370 and was also an avid fisherman. Besides his parents he was preceded in death by his brother, Walton Norris; and two sisters, Ruth Huffman and Gennevive Price. Survivors include his loving wife of 21 years, Charlotte (McCray) Norris; son, Michael Norris; daughters, Karen (Tony) Bowers and Rhonda (Michael) Shaeffer; step-children, David (Linda) Riffle and Kaye (Chuck) Shackle; sister, Eva Jean (Donald) Brown; and grandsons, Michael and Gary Shaeffer; there are also six step - grandchildren, three great-grandchildren and numerous nieces and nephews surviving. Funeral services will be conducted on Tuesday at 11 a.m. in the Reed Funeral Home with Pastor Craig Ott and Pastor Doug Simpson officiating. Calling hours will be on Monday (today) from 5-8 p.m. in the funeral home. In lieu of <<<<<<< HEAD flowers, memorial donations my be made in Lesters name to the Perry Christian ======= flowers, memorial donations my be made in Lester s name to the Perry Christian >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Church.

Novak, Mary A., nee Lysien
Source--Times Leader       Martins Ferry, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Martins Ferry, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--June 6, 2003
    Novak, Mary ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Novak, Mary >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 A. , age 82, of Clarington, Ohio, died Wednesday, June 4, 2003 in Grant Medical Center, Columbus, Ohio.
    She was born ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was born >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 July 11, 1920 in Eldersville, Penn., the daughter of the late Michael and Anna Strynk Lysien.
    She was the ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> She was the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 owner/operator of Clair Tavern in Clarington, Ohio, since 1949, a member of Hannibal Legion Auxiliary, PNA Lodge and St. John's Vianney Catholic Church of Powhatan Point, Ohio.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband Gus Novak.
    Surviving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are a daughter, Lois "Lodzie" (Robert) Gibson of Powhatan Point; a son, Dr. Carl A. "Sonny" (Bonnie) Novak of Clarington; a brother, Carl (Della) Lysien of Powhatan Point; six grandchildren, Mariann (Mark) Gehrig of Clarington, Lois (Art) Hanlin of Powhatan Point, Bobby (Lori) Gibson of Shadyside, Ohio, Carla (George) Whittier of South Carolina, Christina (Bing) Cheng of Twinsburg, Ohio, and Candace Novak and her fiance, Paul Valach of Blacklick, Ohio, nine great - grandchildren and several nieces and nephews.
    Family will ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Family will >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 receive friends on Saturday from 5 to 9 p.m. and Sunday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 9 p.m. at Grisell Funeral Home, 125 Clarinda Drive, Clarington. Funeral Liturgy and Mass will be conducted on Monday at 10:30 a.m. at St. John's Vianney Catholic Church Rt. 7, Powhatan Point, with Fr. Frank Cronin as celebrant. Interment in Powhatan Cemetery, Powhatan.
    Memorial ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Memorial >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 contributions may be made to St. John's Vianney Catholic Church, c/o St. Mary's Catholic Church, P.O. Box 68, Shadyside, OH 43947.

 Ober, Martin V.
Source--Wetzel Democrat    New Martinsville, West Virginia
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Ober, Martin V.
Source--Wetzel Democrat New Martinsville, West Virginia
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--January 23, 1920
            Martin ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Martin >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 V. Ober, one of New Martinsville's most substantial and worthy businessmen, died Saturday morning. Mr. Ober died at his home on South Main Street. Surviving are the following children: George Ober of Clarksburg, West Virginia.; Mrs. M. D. Adley of Brownwood, Texas; Matt Ober of Lamar, Colorado.; and Foster Ober, at home. Mr. Ober was born near Hannibal, Ohio in 1852 and was 68 years of age. He came to New Martinsville when quite young and spent all his life in Wetzel County. He was interested in many enterprises during his business career. He was a member of the Saint John's Methodist Episcopal Church. He was a staunch member of the Democratic party and an active supporter of all its policies and took a lively interest in the affairs of the city, county and state, having been mayor and councilman of the city. Mr. Ober was one of the most prominent and widely known citizens of Wetzel County and was highly respected. News of his death was received with general sorrow and regret. Funeral services were held at Saint John's Methodist Episcopal Church on Tuesday afternoon. Interment was made at the Williams Cemetery in New Martinsville.
SOURCE: "Wetzel Democrat", New Martinsville, West Virginia., January 23, 1920.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
 
Oblinger, Charles G
December 10, 1920
Lewisville
 
 
MARRIAGE, 1905
WEAVER, Mr. John H.
OBLINGER, Miss Mary A.
Mary Oblingers Marriage to John H. Weaver: Clipping ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Mary Oblinger s Marriage to John H. Weaver: Clipping >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Number One
Weaver-Oblinger
            A beautiful home wedding occurred on North Main street, Woodsfield at the brides home July 3, 1905, when Mr. John ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A beautiful home wedding occurred on North Main street, Woodsfield at the bride s home July 3, 1905, when Mr. John >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 H. Weaver and Miss Mary A. Oblinger were quietly pronounced husband and wife by the writer in the presence of the mother and one sister. The groom is a young man of excellent repute, moral in all his habits, straight-forWard and honest in all his transactions. His home is at Sarahsville, though now he is in the employ of the O.R.& W. at Woodsfield. The bride is the youngest daughter of Louis Oblinger, deceased, well known. She is a charming young lady, well known and much respected. These two hearts now beat as one as they launch there ship on the sea of human life. They pass with felicity through the flowery land of <<<<<<< HEAD their Honeymoon, on to the region of lifes realities and responsibilities. May ======= their Honeymoon, on to the region of life s realities and responsibilities. May >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the whole journey be like a beautiful day in May, and Heaven be theirs at last.
                                                            R.W. ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> R.W. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Martin
Clipping Number Two, was printed in The Monroe Gazette
Oblinger-Weaver
             A pretty quite wedding occurred at the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> A pretty quite wedding occurred at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 pleasant home of Mrs. H.A. Oblinger on North Row July 3, 1905, when her youngest daughter, Mary A., was given in marriage to Mr. John H. Weaver, R.W. Martin officiating.
            The bride is one of Woodsfields best and prettiest young ladies, and will
 no doubt make an excellent wife.
            The groom is a young man of correct habits and has a good position in the O.R.& W. Ry office in this place.
            Both ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The bride is one of Woodsfield s best and prettiest young ladies, and will
no doubt make an excellent wife.
The groom is a young man of correct habits and has a good position in the O.R.& W. R y office in this place.
Both >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 are very highly respected young people.
            The ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Gazette wishes to be among the many to offer congratulations and
 express wishes for a happy married life.

Clipping Number Three
 Oblinger-Weaver
            A pretty wedding took place at the home of the brides mother Mrs. Hattie Oblinger July 3, 1905, when her daughter Miss Mary A. Oblinger was united in marriage with Mr. John H. Weaver. Only members of the immediate family were present. The bride was attired in White silk. The happy couple Start on lifes journey under favorable circumstances ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Oblinger-Weaver
A pretty wedding took place at the home of the bride s mother Mrs. Hattie Oblinger July 3, 1905, when her daughter Miss Mary A. Oblinger was united in marriage with Mr. John H. Weaver. Only members of the immediate family were present. The bride was attired in White silk. The happy couple Start on life s journey under favorable circumstances >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 and have the best wishes of many friends. They will be at home after July 13th on Church street.
            Mary ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Mary >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Oblinger Weaver Simmons Bible notations made by her before she died in 1961:
            Between the Apocrypha and the New Testament are five pages of forms designed for family records and two blank pages. The first form is a marriage certificate. This was used to record the marriage of John H Weaver to Mary A Oblinger. It says THIS IS TO CERTIFY That ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Between the Apocrypha and the New Testament are five pages of forms designed for family records and two blank pages. The first form is a marriage certificate. This was used to record the marriage of John H Weaver to Mary A Oblinger. It says THIS IS TO CERTIFY That >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 John H Weaver and Mary A Oblinger WERE UNITED BY ME IN HOLY MATRIMONY At Woodsfield, Ohio on the third day of July In the year of our Lord 1905 in Presence of Mrs. H A Oblinger & Burnice Oblinger Signed Rev R W Martin Shady Side, O.
 
            The next two pages each titled Family Record create a single opening
consisting of five columns with the headings of Name, Place of Birth, Date of Birth, Date of Marriage and Date of . They contain the following entries.

            The fourth page titled Memorandum is simply some blank lines to be used for ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> The fourth page titled Memorandum is simply some blank lines to be used for >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 whatever the owner wants. Mary used this page to record her parents names and birth dates followed by their children. Seven children are recorded. At the Bottom of the page is a handwritten marriage certificate for Mary and Charles H Simmons dated January 10, 1914. Transcription of this page:

 The fifth page is titled Family Temperance ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'>

OConnell, Louis S. and Miss Sharon H. White
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>O Connell, Louis S. and Miss Sharon H. White >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Mr. and Mrs. Louis O'Connell
Published---1958
 
   Miss Sharon ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>
Miss Sharon >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 H. White, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Earl McWilliams of Barnesville, became the bride of Louis S. O'Connell, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis C. O'Connell of Miltonsburg, Route 3, Woodsfield at a 9:30 Nuptial High Mass ceremony solemnized Saturday morning, September seventh, in St. John's Catholic Church, Miltonsburg. Father EdWard Kakascik officiated at the double ring ceremony.
   Given in ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Given in >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 marriage by her step-father, the bride wore a Kaufman original, which was ballerina in length and composed of fine silk lace over white taffeta. The tightly moulded bodice was sleeveless, featuring a Sabrina neckline, Empire waist, which was encircled with a taffeta bow and ribbon.The skirt fell into soft molds. She wore a shoulder length veil of bridal illusion, which was held in place with a dainty lace cloche, trimmed with tiny pearl beads. The illusion was encircled with a fine hand-rolled hem. She carried a white lace-covered prayer book topped by a single white orchid. The tradition of something old, new, borrowed and blue was carried out.
   Miss Georgia ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Miss Georgia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 McCort, of Malaga was maid of honor. She wore a pale blue cotton gown fashioned with tucked bodice, long torso, and full skirt. Her corsage was of pink Rosebuds.
   A cousin of the groom, William Calvert, of Woodsfield, served as best man.
   For her ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> A cousin of the groom, William Calvert, of Woodsfield, served as best man.
For her >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 daughter's wedding, Mrs. McWilliams chose an aqua dress with white accessories. The groom's mother, Mrs. O'Connell, wore a teal dress with black accessories. They both were corsages of yellow Rosebuds.
  Grandmother of ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Grandmother of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 the bride, Mrs. Fred Jones, of Barnesville, wore navy and the groom's grandmother, Mrs. Rosa Brubach, of Route 3, Woodsfield wore purple. They both wore corsages of white carnations.
  Immediately ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Immediately >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 following the ceremony, a breakfast was served to the wedding party at the home of the groom's parents.
  Before leaving ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Before leaving >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 on a western motor trip, the bride changed to a light blue silk dress with matching bolero jacket and white accessories. She wore the orchid which she had carried on her prayer book. The couple is now residing on Route 3, Woodsfield.
  The new Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> The new Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 O'Connel was graduated from Barnesville High School in 1957, and before her marriage was employed by the G.C. Murphy Co. In Barnesville.
   Mr. O'Connell ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. O'Connell >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 was graduated fromBeallsville, Ohio High School in 1955, and is presently employed by The Watt Car and Wheel Co. in Barnesville.
Typed by betty Lendon matson

Ogg, Miss Verda Laura and Mr. Samuel S. Friday
Source:The Spirit of Democracy
Woodsfield, Ohio, Thurs., November 23, 1916
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig
               Mr. Samuel S. FRIDAY and Miss ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Samuel S. FRIDAY and Miss >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Verda Laura OGG were married November 14, 1916, by the Reverend W. W. Davis.
 
Ogilbee, Larry Albert
Source--The Daily Jeffersonian     Cambridge, Ohio
Published--June   2001                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Larry Albert Olgilbee, 54, of Ogilbee, Larry Albert, 54,  of ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cambridge, Ohio
Published--June 2001 Larry Albert Olgilbee, 54, of Ogilbee, Larry Albert, 54, of >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Jacobsburg, died Wednesday ,June 27, 2001, at Wheeling Hospital.
He was born Oct. 2, 1946, in Barnesville, son of the Mary Kemp Ogilbee of Belmont and the late Albert Ogilbee.
He was a member of the Centerville Christian Church, a clerk for the Smith Township trustees and a dairy farmer.
He leaves his mother; his wife, Joyce Kanzigg Ogilbee; a daughter, Mrs. Adam (Jessica) Crum of Centerville; two sons, Lance Ogilbee of New Knoxville and Justin (Valerie) Ogilbee of St. Clairsville; a grandson, Devin Crum; three brothers, Wayne of St. Clairsville, Roger of Powhatan and Keith of Jacobsburg; and several nieces and nephews.
Friends may call 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday at Kelly-Kemp-Braido Funeral Home, where services will be 2 p.m. Sunday with Rev. Keith Kaczor officiating. Burial will be in Wesley Chapel Cemetery near Belmont.
