Powell, John
BARNESVILLE---John Powell, 80, 330 Sycamore St., was found dead in a clump of berry bushes near Crestview Cemetery Saturday evening by his son, Francis.
  Mr. Powell had ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Mr. Powell had >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 left his home at 7 o'clock in the morning, and authorities believe he died of a heart attack a short time later.
  Surviving are his wife, Mildred and eight children,  Mrs. Edna Phillips, Daniel and Raymond Powell, all of Ashland,  Francis, Mrs. Lillian Lucas, Frank, Clarence and Walter, all of Barnesville;  13 grandchildren and five great-grandchildren;  six sisters, Mrs. Ada Keylor, Oklahoma,  Mrs. Dolly Harper of Bellaire, Mrs. Ella Creighton, and Mrs. Effie Tacker, both of Youngstown,  Mrs. Tillie Taylor and Mrs. Katie Zogg both of Woodsfield.
  Services will be conducted Tuesday afternoon at the Campbell Funeral Home in charge of Rev. C. N. Jarrett, pastor of the First Christian Church.  Burial will follow in Northern Cemetery.  Monday 3 July 1950 Jeffersonian. 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Surviving are his wife, Mildred and eight children, Mrs. Edna Phillips, Daniel and Raymond Powell, all of Ashland, Francis, Mrs. Lillian Lucas, Frank, Clarence and Walter, all of Barnesville; 13 grandchildren and five great-grandchildren; six sisters, Mrs. Ada Keylor, Oklahoma, Mrs. Dolly Harper of Bellaire, Mrs. Ella Creighton, and Mrs. Effie Tacker, both of Youngstown, Mrs. Tillie Taylor and Mrs. Katie Zogg both of Woodsfield.
Services will be conducted Tuesday afternoon at the Campbell Funeral Home in charge of Rev. C. N. Jarrett, pastor of the First Christian Church. Burial will follow in Northern Cemetery. Monday 3 July 1950 Jeffersonian.

Pratt, Henry
Died: May 31, 1914
 
 Prezalinski, Anna                                                                                 Source--Wheeling News Register      Wheeling, West Virginia                                      ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Prezalinski, Anna Source--Wheeling News Register Wheeling, West Virginia >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Published---1936
 
Resident of Wheeling since early childhood succumbs Friday
 
Mrs. Anna Jeneskee Weings Prezalinski, 65, widow of Frank Prezalinski and a resident of Wheeling since childhood died Friday evening at 6:15 o' clock at her home, 4404 Wetzel Street. She suffered a paralytic stroke May 4 and a second stroke last night caused her death.Mrs. Prezalinski was born in New Jersey, Septemeber, 22, 1871, a daughter of John and Louise Jeneskee, and came to Wheeling with her parents when a child. She was a member of Immaculate Conception church and was affiliated with the P.T.A. of St. Mary's school. She was married to Mr. Prezalinski 50 years ago. He preceeded her in death 33 years ago. Surviving are 6 daughters, Mrs. Micheal Osmainanski, Mrs. Ann May, Mrs. Lawrence Manning, Mrs. Joseph Kuskey, all of Wheeling, and the Misses Bernadine and Marcella Weings, at home; 2 sons, John Prezalinski at home, Joseph Prezalinski, at home; 3 brothers, Harry C., William and Frank Janeskee, all of Wheeling; three sisters, Mrs. Mary Mulley, of Follansbee, WVa., Mrs. Lucy Dunn, of Sardis, Ohio , Mrs. Rose White, of Wheeling; 22 grandchildren and one great-grandchild. The body was removed to the Altmeyer funeral home and this afternoon was returned to the late residence. Brief services will be held at the home Tuesday morning at 8:15 o'clock. A mass of requiem will be celebrated at 9 o'clock in Imaculate Conception church. Mount Calvary cemetery will be the place of burial.
 
Price, Clarence Price
 
February 28, 1891
 
December 1967
 
Woodsfield
 
Price, John "Ben" Benson
Source--Wetzel County Message Board   West Virginia
Published--December   1989
 PRICE, John Ben Benson, 74, of Pine Grove, Wetzel County, West Virginia, died Friday, ======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> West Virginia
Published--December 1989
PRICE, John Ben Benson, 74, of Pine Grove, Wetzel County, West Virginia, died Friday, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 December 1, 1989 in Ohio Valley Medical Center, Wheeling. He was a retired superintendent of Hastings Station for Consolidated Gas Suppy Corporation., Clarksburg, a member of the Baptist Church, Williamstown, West Virginia, and a Navy veteran of World War II. He was preceded in death by a daughter, Donna Jeanne, in 1948. Surviving are his wife, Lucille Beeghley Price; a son, James <<<<<<< HEAD B. of New Martinsville; a brother, Colonel  ======= B. of New Martinsville; a brother, Colonel >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Robert F. Price, Prescott, Arizona; two sisters, Mrs. Randolph (Jeannette) Johnson of Oak Hill, West Virginia and Mrs. Maurice (Louise) Johnson of Williamstown; three grandsons. Friends were received at Iams Funeral Home, New Martinsville where services were held. Interment in Broad Run Baptist Church Cemetery, Jane Lew, West Virginia. Arrangements by Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield. Memorial contributions was made to the American Cancer Society or the Saint Paul United Methodist Church, Pine Grove, West Virginia.

Priest, George Washington
Source--Chistian Standard       Wichita, Kansas
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Wichita, Kansas >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published---October 13, 1917
 Priest,George W.  of New Martinsville, West Virginia, ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Priest,George W. of New Martinsville, West Virginia, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died August 29, 1917. He was born December 14, 1850. He united with the church in September 1864, at Duffy, Monroe County, Ohio, and served that church as an Elder until 1891, when he became a member of the church at New Martinsville, West Virginia. He was the son of the late Dr. J. B. and Hannah (Yocum) Priest. He was united in marriage to Miss Caroline Harmon of Ohio, May 30, 1869, to which union eight children were born, three daughters dying in infancy. He had been in poor health for some time and at the time of his going away was on a brief visit to his brother, Dr. S.C. Priest, at Newark, O. The funeral services were conducted by L. R. Doak, minister of the New Martinsville church, on Friday afternoon, August 31. A very large number of citizens in all walks of life, by whom he was so well loved, were in attendance. He leaves a wife and five sons, a sister, )Mrs. C.A. Kleeberger, Columbus, Ohio) , two brothers, (Dr. Priest, Newark, Ohio, Walter Scott Priest, Wichita, Kansas) and a host of friends to morn their loss..
 
Probst, Arthur

Sardis
 
Probst, Charles E. Probst

August 21, 1994

Prout, John A.
Woodsfield - John A. Prout, 55, of 51185 Township Road 9, Woodsfield, died Thursday (Sept. 16, 2004) at the Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville, Ohio.
Arrangements are pending at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.
Source: The Marietta Times, Friday, September 17, 2004

Pryor, K. Richard and Sandra Lee
Source--Daily Jeffersonian        Cambridge, Ohio
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'> Cambridge, Ohio >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published--August 23, 1986
BARNESVILLE--K. Richard and Sandra Lee Pryor, 59960 Pigeon Point Road, Barnesville, will celebrate their 25th wedding anniversary September 9.
An open house in their honor will be hosted by the couple's children from 2 to 4 p.m. August 31 at The Hutton Memorial Library (Laura Dobbins Room) in Barnesville. The couple requests no gifts.
Mr. and Mrs Pryor were married September 9, 1961, in Graysville, by the Reverend Milfrid Cary. She is the daughter of William Prickett, Woodsfield, and Flota Prickett, Lewisville. He is the son of of Kenneth and Linda Pryor, Barnesville.
Mr. Pryor is employed with the R and F Coal Company and is a self-employed auctioneer.
They are the parents of five children, Mrs. Ronald (Jackie) Burga, Salesville; Mrs. Timothy (Pam) Burga, Barnesville; Richard and Steven, both of Virginia Beach, Virginia and Sherry, of the home. The couple have two sons-in-laws, two daughters-in-law and four grandchildren.
 
======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
 
Pryor, Louvirda

April 1972

PRYOR, Samuel R.
               Samuel R, PRYOR died March 2, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Samuel R, PRYOR died March 2, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 1911. He was born September 18, 1856, near Stafford, Monroe County, Ohio, the son of Euphroneous PRYOR, who died January 15, 1903, and Susan Ruble PRYOR, who died January 14, 1908.
               Samuel attended the public and ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Samuel attended the public and >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 normal schools of the County and qualified himself for teaching which he followed for fourteen years. On December 9, 1881, he was united in marriage to Miss Jennie SLOAN, daughter of Oliver S. and Mary Zillah DAILY SLOAN, of near Stafford, and to this union were born a son, Eber PRYOR, who died in infancy, and a daughter, Maud PRYOR, now the wife of Mr. Roy SCHUMACHER, of Woodsfield. In 1888 he purchased a portion of his father's farm where twelve happy years were spent.
               In 1900 he was elected to the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In 1900 he was elected to the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 office of County Auditor, which office he filled for one term, 1901-4, and on account of which he moved his family to Woodsfield in 1901 where he resided until the time of his .
               In 1871 he united with the Church ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> In 1871 he united with the Church >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of Christ, of which he remained faithful member. He was baptized by Elder Joe Walters.
               He was the youngest of a family ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> He was the youngest of a family >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 of seven children whose names follow in the order of their ages, the oldest being mentioned first: William H. PRYOR who died April 21, 1901, near Graysville; Miss Elizabeth PRYOR of Woodsfield; Mrs. Hannah McFREDERICK who died July 18, 1905; Isaac PRYOR of near Graysville; Mrs. Lydia Ann FArnSWORTH of Nankin, Ashland County, Ohio; John T. PRYOR of near Graysville, and Samuel R. PRYOR the subject of this sketch.
               Mr. Pryor's was caused by a ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Pryor's was caused by a >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 complication of ailments. He first complained about a year ago, since when his health declined gradually and rapidly in spite of all that medical skill and careful nursing could do.
               Funeral services were held at the ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Funeral services were held at the >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 residence on North Main Street, Saturday, March 4, 1 o'clock, p.m. conducted by Elders Charles FOGEL and J. A. Hines. Interment in the family burying plot in Oaklawn Cemetery.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, March 1911
 
 
PUGH, Mr. Aaron
               Mr. Aaron PUGH, aged 84 years, ======= style='mso-tab-count:1'> Mr. Aaron PUGH, aged 84 years, >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 died at this home at Ozark, Ohio February 14, 1916. The funeral services were held Wednesday afternoon. A number of relatives and friends from Woodsfield attended the services. Mr. Pugh was widely known as an upright citizen.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, February 17, 1916

Pugh, Schafer, Ivy Jane Pugh                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
Source: Wheeling Register,Wheeling, W.Va.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
======= style='mso-spacerun:yes'>
Source: Wheeling Register,Wheeling, W.Va.
>>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711
Published-Sunday, January 8, 1928
            Schafer,Mrs. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> Schafer,Mrs. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Ivy Jane , 63, died Saturday evening at 5 o'clock at her home, Route No. 2, Bellaire. Death was reported due to complications incident to advanced age. Mrs. Schafer had been a resident of Bellaire for the past 25 years. She is survived by her husband, George Schafer; her aged mother, Mrs. Sarah Pugh; three daughters, Mrs. Freda Baker, of Bellaire; Mrs. Vera Keyser, of Bellaire, and Miss Elizabeth, at home; one son-in-law, Doctor Earl A. Schafer, of Bellaire; four sisters, Mrs. Alveratta Fraley, of Oklahoma; Mrs. Hannah Rothenbuhler, of Cameron, Ohio; Mrs. Anna Hoppon, of Bellaire, Ohio, Mrs. Airzona Strickler, of Okark, Ohio, and three brothers, Elmer, of Businessburg, Ohio; Adolph, of Ozark, Ohio, and Walter, of Canton.Funeral services will be conducted from the home on Wednesday morning at 10 o'clock, with Reverend B. F. Leach, pastor of the Christian church of Somerton, Ohio, in charge. Following the services from the home the body will be taken to Somerton, Ohio, where services will be conducted at the Christian church at 1:30 o'clock Wednesday afternoon, with Reverend Leach in charge.

Pugh, Susan J.

 John C. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> John C. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pumphrey
February 12, 1949-August 4, 2004
 
 
A funeral service for John C. Pumphrey, 55, of Utica, will be held at 10 a.m. Monday at the Bladensburg Church of Christ, with Mr. Stan Ratliff officiating. Burial will follow in Bladensburg Cemetery.
 
Mr. Pumphrey died unexpectedly Wednesday, August 4, 2004. He was born February 12, 1949, in Mount Vernon, to Charles and Elma (Highman) Pumphrey.
 
Mr. Pumphrey was a member of the Bladensburg Church of Christ and a 20-year employee of the U.S. Postal Service. He was also a self-employed mechanic.
 
He is survived by his wife of 34 years, Jane (Jewell) Pumphrey; a son, Douglas (Amanda) Pumphrey of Jacksonville, Fla.; two daughters, Sherri (Michael) Moreland and Stacy Pumphrey, both of Utica; two sisters, Patty Pumphrey of Martinsburg, and Jill (Fred) Pletcher of Newark; one brother, Phil (Gina) Pumphrey of Columbus; and five grandchildren, Ashley, Michael, Brandon, John and Noah.
 
Friends may call from 2 to 5 p.m. Sunday at the Harris-Dilley Funeral Home in Bladensburg.
 
Memorial contributions may be made in John Pumphrey's name to The Alzheimer's Association, 1 Marion Ave., Suite 108, Mansfield, Ohio 44903.
Source--The Advocate  ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'>Source--The Advocate >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Newark, Ohio, Published--August 6, 2004
Provided by betty Lendon matson

Pyles, James M.
The Spirit of Democracy
Thursday, March 15, 1917
    James M. ======= mso-fareast-language:JA'> James M. >>>>>>> ef9da23e9f6816b69f175e37096e452723be7711 Pyles of Round Bottom, Ohio, died March 8,1917, aged seventy-four years and five months.
    He was a member of Company F., 180th Ohio Infantry.
    He is survived by a wife and five children---Mrs. Minnie Wood of Akron,Ohio,  Mrs. Mary McIntire of Round Bottom,  Mrs. Wesley Haslam of Clarington, Ohio,  William Pyles of Round Bottom and  Caroline at home.

He is survived by a wife and five children---Mrs. Minnie Wood of Akron,Ohio, Mrs. Mary McIntire of Round Bottom, Mrs. Wesley Haslam of Clarington, Ohio, William Pyles of Round Bottom and Caroline at home.
